Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Yodha (Brevinin family, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: Indosylvirana aurantiaca, Sri Lanka and South India, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (57.14%) toBrevinin-2CEActivity: The peptide is virucidal against both Zika virus (ZIKV) (D=L) and dengue viruses (DENV). Yodha peptide efficiently inhibited DENV1 (IC50 25 uM), DENV2 (IC50 2 uM), DENV3 (IC50 70 uM), and DENV4 (IC50 30 uM).Toxicity:  not hemo.lytic at 160 uM to hRBC.Animal model:mouse:  C57BL/6: D-Yodha was IP injected 5 h before infection in the footpad with 100,000 focus forming units of ZIKV strain PRVABC. After peptide injection daily for 3 days, viral load was reduced.
Literature Information.Author: Lee SH, Kim EH, O'neal JT, Dale G, Holthausen DJ, Bowen JR, Quicke KM, Skountzou I, Gopal S, George S, Wrammert J, Suthar MS, Jacob J. 2021
Literature Information.Title: The amphibian peptide Yodha is virucidal for Zika and dengue viruses.
